page.title: 01Bramdean Village
page.content: Spread out village with one shop,one pub,church, garage, post office and stores. 9 miles east of Winchester, 9 miles west of Petersfield, 4 miles south east of Alresford. Farming region, with many people commuting to Winchester and other towns for work. Several large houses; much of land owned by large estates, and the National Trust. Considerable quantities of mixed beech and oak woodland. Pheasant shooting is important, with pheasants specially bred in the area for the purpose. Some small tradesmen work from the village. There is a village hall. The village school closed in 1985. The village has a rural atmosphere in spite of being bisected by a busy through route.
